contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[June]] 2001: [[January 2001|January]] – [[February 2001|February]] – [[March 2001|March]] – [[April 2001|April]] – [[May 2001|May]] – June – [[July 2001|July]] – [[August 2001|August]] – [[September 2001|September]] – [[October 2001|October]] – [[November 2001|November]] – [[December 2001|December]] '''June 2001''' was the sixth month of that year. It started on Friday, after 30 days, ended on Saturday. {| class="infobox" width="250" style="text-align: center; margin-top:7px; background-color: #f5faff; border:2px solid #cedff2;" |- style="background-color: #cedff2" | style="padding-top: 5px; padding-bottom: 5px" | [[May 2001|<<]] | colspan=5 style="padding: 2px 0px" |'''June 2001''' | style="padding-top: 2px; padding-bottom: 1px" | [[July 2001|>>]] |- |S |M |T |W |T |F |S |- |colspan= "5"| |'''[[#2001 June 1|1]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 2|2]]''' |- |'''[[#2001 June 3|3]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 4|4]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 5|5]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 6|6]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 7|7]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 8|8]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 9|9]]''' |- |'''[[#2001 June 10|10]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 11|11]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 12|12]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 13|13]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 14|14]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 15|15]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 16|16]]''' |- |'''[[#2001 June 17|17]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 18|18]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 19|19]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 20|20]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 21|21]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 22|22]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 23|23]]''' |- |'''[[#2001 June 24|24]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 25|25]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 26|26]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 27|27]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 28|28]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 29|29]]''' |'''[[#2001 June 30|30]]''' |- |} ==Events== ===June 1, 2001=== * The popular [[Bratz]], rival to the Barbie doll, debuts. * Royal Family of Nepal massacred. ===June 5, 2001=== * The [[Harehills riots]] takes place in [[Harehills]], [[Leeds]], UK, after a questionable arrest of an Asian man for possession of an illegal car tax disc. Lasted until June 6th. * [[Houston, Texas]], is devastated by flooding when [[Tropical Storm Allison]] dumps 36 inches (914 mm) of [[rain]] on the city. Damage exceeds five billion [[United States dollar|American dollars]] over a 4-day period until June 9th. ===June 7, 2001=== * [[Tony Blair]]'s [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] elected for second term in [[United Kingdom general election, 2001|UK General Election]] ===June 11, 2001=== * Oklahoma City bomber [[Timothy McVeigh]] executed in Indiana ===June 14, 2001=== * The black beret becomes the standard headgear for all United State Army soldiers. ===June 19, 2001=== * 23 people killed and 11 wounded by an American [[missile]] hitting a [[soccer]] field in northern [[Iraq]], county of [[Tel Afr]] ===June 20, 2001=== * [[Andrea Yates]] drowns her five children in a bathtub and confesses to her crimes. ===June 21, 2001=== * [[Solar eclipse of June 21, 2001|Total solar eclipse]] * Died: Actor [[Carroll O'Connor]] dies aged 76. ===June 29, 2001=== * Died: Artist and writer [[Mary Barnes]] dies aged 78. {{Events by month links}} [[Category:June|2001]] [[Category:2001|*2001-06]]
